info.description:
**IMPORTANT:** This is a work in progress, and all information may change at any time. Final APIs may look very different. Until there is an official release, these APIs should be seen as unfinished drafts.

**General guidelines:**

* We use camelCase, starting with lowercase: ```customerEngagement```, ```accountNumber```, ```creditCard```, etc.
* Unless implicit by Swagger, standards are mentioned and refered to.
* General rule: The response (object) determines endpoint: If the response is ```account```, the endpoint should be under ```/accounts```. In cases where this may be up for discussion, multiple endpoints may, for a limited time, be available in order to evaluate.

**Standards:**

All APIs use ISO and RFC standards:

* Swagger specification: https://swagger.io/specification/
* Country: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2: : https://www.iso.org/standard/63546.html (```NO```, ```GB```, ```US```)
* Currency: ISO 4217: alpha 3-letter upcase: https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html (```NOK```, ```EUR```, ```USD```)
* Date: According to Swagger specification: ISO 8601:  www.iso.org/iso/home/standards/iso8601.htm (date: ```2018-12-31```, timestamp: ```2018-12-31T23:59:59+01:00```)
* SWIFT BIC: ISO 9362: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_9362 (```DNBANOKKXXX```)
* IBAN ISO 13616:2007: https://www.iso.org/standard/41031.html (```NO9386011117947```)
* MCC: ISO 18245: https://www.iso.org/standard/33365.html (https://github.com/greggles/mcc-codes) (```3514: Hotels/Motels/Inns/Resorts```)

**HTTP Response Codes**

HTTP response are intended to be logical: If a ```customer```or an ```account``` does not exist, the response is ```404 Not Found```.  All errors return a relevant HTTP status code and response with an ``error`` containing additional details. The HTTP statuses returnbed are:

Success

* ```200: OK``` Success!   
* ```201: Created``` Resource created. Reference included.

Client Error

* ```400: Bad Request``` Yor request was, somehow, not ok.  
* ```401: Unauthorized``` You are unknown.   
* ```403: Forbidden``` You are authorized, but you are attempting something you are not allowed to.  
* ```404: Not Found``` What you looked for is not here.  
* ```429: Too Many Requests``` Settle down!

Server Error

* ```500: Server Error``` We screwed up, sorry!
* ```503: Service Unavailable``` Something is very wrong.
* ```504: Timeout``` We need to speed up internally,  

**Github**

Swagger documentation is (for now) available on Github: https://github.com/cloveras/dnb/
info.title: DNB Developer APIs
info.termsOfService:
Be nice. Thanks!
http://developer.dnb.no/terms (404 for now)

get.description:
**NOTE:** This endpoint may disappear, as ```/customers/{customerId}``` offers the same functionality.

Get current ```customer``` details. The ```customerId```is included in the context object.
Get ```customer``` details by id.

get.summary: Get all accounts for current user

get.description: Returns Account.

**Note:** Duplicates endpoint in ```Transactions```. For evaluation purposes. 

Optional query parameters below. Note: Sorting and filtering affects backend, and may change.

* SortOrder: "ASC", "DESC"
* DateFrom: "YYYY-MM-DD": ISO 8601: www.iso.org/iso/home/standards/iso8601.htm
* DateTo: "YYYY-MM-DD": ISO 8601: www.iso.org/iso/home/standards/iso8601.htm
* AmountMinimum: Include amount from (and including) this amount.
* AmountMaximum: Include amount from (and including) this amount.
* MCC: Include only this MCC code: ISO 18245: https://www.iso.org/standard/33365.html 
* FreeText: Filter by free text

parameters.name: amountMinimum
parameters.description: Filter for minimum amount (included). No decimals.

parameters.name: amountMaximum
parameters.description: Filter for maximum amount (included). No decimals.

parameters.name: MCC
parameters.description: Filter for MCC. Use code only.

parameters.name: freeText
parameters.description: Filter for free text. Case insensitive.

get.description: **Note:** Duplicates endpoint in ```Transactions```. For evaluation purposes.

get.summary: Get due payments for account by date range
Get details for a payment for an account

Domestic payment with KID or message.

Returns HTTP 201 and the ```PaymentId``` of successfully created payment.

schema.description: Returning id of the new payment

get.summary: Get due payments for an account
get.description: Gets all due ```payment```s, both domestic and international.

get.summary: Get due payment by payment id
get.description:
Returns ```payment,``` complete with with ```paymentDetails```.

This endpoint may change, as it is offers the same as ```accounts/{accountNumber}/payments/due/{paymentId}```, and the placement is not decided yet.

patch.description:
A ```payment``` can be updatet until due date:
* Date 
* Amount
* Status (deactivate, reactivate)

Returns the updated ```payment```.

get.summary: Convert amount from CUR1 to CUR2
get.description: Quite basic for now. Input welcome.

get.summary: Get a list rates for the most common currencies, with a specified base

get.description: Basic geocoding functionality similar to Google Maps: https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/geocoding/intro

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: For now: Assume geocoding functionality similar to Google Maps: https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/geocoding/intro

get.description: Contact information, opening hours, etc.
Opening times is also included in Branch.
If no details (as for now): Assume ATM is open 24h.

get.summary: Get list of all DNB branches

customerId.description: SSN (11 digits) or organization number (9 digits).

firstName.description: First name. May be used for the contact person if type is ```COMPANY```.

lastName.description: Surname. May be used for the contact person if type is ```COMPANY```.

phone.description: Including "+" and international prefix. E.164: https://www.twilio.com/docs/glossary/what-e164 Whitespace and dashes are stripped.

customer.description:
One common ```customer```data object for all kinds of customers: Private customers, business customers, and others.

Please note:
* Some updates may be required.
* Should be aligned with Shared Services Layer: https://shasl.restlet.io/#type_customer
* Should be aligned with CIM, while still hiding internal complexity and making it easy to understand and use.

engagementType.description: Types of engagements: To be determined. Needs to be aligned with DNB CIM, without exposing internal complexity.

customerEngagement.description:
Used with ```customer```. 

Work in progress. See https://shasl.restlet.io/#type_engagement

accountNumber.description: 11 digits. Bank, etc can be determined from this: https://no.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kontonummer

account.description:
Same ```account``` data object is used for all types of accounts. The ```type``` property determines the type. 

An ```account``` may have ```accountDetails```, which may again have ```accountBalance``` and  ```accountInterestDetails```.

A Norwegian ```account```has three groups: xxxx yy zzzzc.
* xxxx: Bank register number, identifying bank and branch. 
* yy: Account group. 
* zzzz: Customer account number.  
* c: Control digit, modulo 11 with weight number 5432765432.

IBAN.description: ISO 13616:2007: https://www.iso.org/standard/41031.html No whitespace. Enjoy the regex.

accountDetails.description:
Details for an ```account```, with optional reference to ```accountDetails```.

IBAN help: http://www.xe.com/ibancalculator/sample/?ibancountry=norway

accountInterestDetails.description: Details about an the interest for an ```account```.

maskedCardNumber.description: 16 characters: Twelve "X", and the last four digits of the card number. No whitespace.

accountNumber.description: Both for debit and credit cards

blockCode.description: If blocked: Code for the blocking reason.

enum: Card blocked by customer - card is allowed to unblock
Card blocked by customer - card is not allowed to unblock
Card blocked for e-commerce by customer service
Card blocked for e-commerce by customer

amountAvailable.description: Debit: The amount in the ```account```.Credit: The limit minus the registered payments.

payment.description:
**NOTE:** May be completely merged with ```transaction```.

A ```payment``` is a planned payment/transaction that has not yet been carried out.

Details about a payment. Used by:
* /payments/due/{accountNumber}: Returning a list of payments, with _empty_ PaymentDetails
* /payments/due/{accountNumber}/details: Returning a list of payments, with PaymentDetails

paymentDetails.description: More details about a payment. Some payment types have more data than others.

message.description: Used for both KID and Message, based on Type.

paymentInitiation.description:
Three types of payments
* KID: Customer Identification (2-25 digits, including control digit)
* Message: Text message describing the payment

Not including the "straksbetaling" (imediate payment) flag, as this will be the default.

Payment initiator: Part of the contxt object, but kept here too for reference.

currency.description: If not the currency of the account/card.

description.example: Lunch at The Restaurant at the End of the Universe

status.description: Booked, reserved, and, if this is to be merged with ```payment```: Completed (or something similar, to indicate that this has, in fact, been processed and finalized)

merchantName.description: Name of merchant. With a merhant register, this could be replaced with a (for now, non-existant) ```merchantId```.

MCC.description: MCC: Number and "combined description". ISO 18245: https://www.iso.org/standard/33365.html

transaction.description:
A ```transaction``` is a completed operation, in contrast to ```payment```, which is planned, but not completed.

The same ```transaction``` is used for all types of transactions: DNB-only account transactions, domestic transactions, international transactions, card transactions, etc. Some transaction types have more fields and data than others. A developer does not need to know about different transaction types when retrieving them, this is .

Should have enough data to be useful both for presenting information to an end user, and for data analysis. Mey be extended, possibly to include ```merchantId```with a reference to more details about merchant, as well as ```location```data, etc.

MCC codes: https://github.com/greggles/mcc-codes Example for a hotel:
```
{
    "mcc": "3514",
    "edited_description": "Hotels/Motels/Inns/Resorts",
    "combined_description": "Hotels/Motels/Inns/Resorts",
    "usda_description": "",
    "irs_description": "Hotels/Motels/Inns/Resorts",
    "irs_reportable": "Yes",
    "id": 418
}
```

address.description: Corresponds with address fields used internally in DNB.

description.description: May be used for large areas like airports, train stations, stadiums, etc.

location.description: Data object for physical location based on GPS coordinates. May be used for something that does not have a specific address, or somethjing that needs a more specific than an address provides, such as an ```ATM``` at a train station. A ```location``` may be used in addition to an ```address```.

phoneNumber.description: Including "+" and international prefix. Whitespace is stripped.

openingTimes.description:
Opening times for a ```branch```, ```ATM```, or something else.

If open 24 hours, use "00:00" both for ```openingTime``` and ```closingTime```.

errorDocumentation.description: URI to developer documentation for this error

errorDetails.description: Details about the cause of this error. Zero or more.

error.description:
The HTTP status code (```httpStatus```) is the main classifier. A DNB-specific ```errorNumber```is also provided as a lookup reference. 

The ```errorDocumentation``` is a URI to further information about the endpoint, with uesful infomration about correct usage.

The ```errorDetails```is specific information about the one or more errors that have occurred.

errorField.description: Name of field that caused the error.

errorDescription.example: First name cannot have non-Latin characters.

errorDetails.description: Detailed explanation of the error. Used by ```error```.

headerLinks.description:
URIs for previous, this and next. Only this (self) is required, as previous and next may not exist).

See also global headers for pagination: ```pageNumber```and ```pageSize```.

currencyRate.description:
Used by ```/currencies/list/{base}``` for a response similar to:

```
{
    timestamp: 1504548341,
    base: "NOK",
    rates: {
        AED: 3.672538,
        AFN: 66.809999,
        ALL: 125.716501,
        AMD: 484.902502,
        ANG: 1.788575,
        AOA: 135.295998,
        ARS: 9.750101,
        AUD: 1.390866,
        /* ... */
    }
}
```
